data.name: Black Magic Gamebox
data.detailed_description:
The Black Magic Gamebox includes 4 games: 2 Singleplayer games and 2 Multiplayer games:

They Came From Earth...Again
  • The Sequel to a game I made for a game jam in the past. Play as an astronaut collecting aliens in order to become the richest man in the galaxy. Travel to different planets; upgrade your ship to enable safer, faster, and more efficient farming of aliens; and gain achievements to prove to the galaxy you are the richest and most successful alien hunter alive. But be careful of alien turrets and tanks as they will try to stop you as you take their citizens. Do you have what it takes to become the best alien hunter there has ever been?

The Lightbringer
  • Play as a mage with the ability to heal people by killing the demons inside of them. Patients come in with the hopes of you being able to cure them of their deadly illnesses and your job is to do your best to cure them. Once linked to a patient, you will fight inside their body against the demons trying to kill them. If you can successfully kill the demons haunting the patient, you will be successful in curing the patient and will return back to the physical world; however, if you are killed while inside the patient, you will be lost forever. How many patients can you cure before your eventual end?

Mages and Monsters
  • The party game where you and your friends work together to successfully complete a quest. Team up with a group of friends as a band of mages trying to complete quests to obtain gold and glory. Play as a variety of characters, each with unique stats, skills, and looks. Attempt different quests that offer unique experiences each time you attempt them. While on the quests, attack monsters, creatures, and other enemies; talk with NPCs that offer wares, training, and unique challenges; make decisions about traversing the land that impacts the party; and cook food for your party that either helps or hurts your party.

Dungeon Dice Monsters
    The party game that involves rolling for monsters, arenas, and combat through multiple rounds until one player is ultimately crowned the winner. Players will try to build a team of mages that work together to destroy other teams of mages. At the start of rounds, players will roll once to determine which current mages get upgraded and which mages can be added to their team. Afterward, players are matched to other players to fight and an arena is chosen at random, each with bonuses to specific mages. Combat then ensues with dice rolls occurring when necessary. Can you forge a team that takes the crown?
